snippet: The indictment of Mahmoud Doaei, the managing editor of Ettelaat, one of Iran’s oldest newspapers, reflected political tensions heading into elections in February.
abstract: Mahmoud Doaei, editor of Iranian newspaper Ettelaat, is indicted for defying ban on covering country's former Pres Mohammad Khatami.

byline.contributor: Hwaida Saad contributed reporting from Beirut, Lebanon.

lead_paragraph: The indictment of Mahmoud Doaei, the managing editor of Ettelaat, one of Iran’s oldest newspapers, reflected political tensions heading into elections in February.

headline.main: Iran Editor Is Charged With Defying Ban on Covering Ex-President
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Middle East; Iran: Editor Is Accused of Violating Ban on Covering Former President
